member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest
member.summary:
Represents a request from the client. A request is as follows.
Field Name Type Size (bytes) ---------------------------------------------------- Length Integer 4 Language RequestLanguage 4 Argument Count UInteger 4 Arguments Argument[] Variable
See for the format of an Argument.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest.ReadAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Read a Request from the given stream.
The total request size must be less than 1MB.
member.returns: null if the Request was too large, the Request otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest.WriteAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Write a Request to the stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest.Argument
member.summary:
A command line argument to the compilation. An argument is formatted as follows:
Field Name Type Size (bytes) -------------------------------------------------- ID UInteger 4 Index UInteger 4 Value String Variable
Strings are encoded via a length prefix as a signed 32-bit integer, followed by an array of characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildResponse
member.summary:
Base class for all possible responses to a request. The ResponseType enum should list all possible response types and ReadResponse creates the appropriate response subclass based on the response type sent by the client. The format of a response is:
Field Name Field Type Size (bytes) ------------------------------------------------- responseLength int (positive) 4 responseType enum ResponseType 4 responseBody Response subclass variable

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildResponse.ReadAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: May throw exceptions if there are pipe problems.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompletedBuildResponse
member.summary:
Represents a Response from the server. A response is as follows.
Field Name Type Size (bytes) -------------------------------------------------- Length UInteger 4 ReturnCode Integer 4 Output String Variable ErrorOutput String Variable
Strings are encoded via a character count prefix as a 32-bit integer, followed by an array of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.MismatchedVersionBuildResponse.AddResponseBody(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: MismatchedVersion has no body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants
member.summary: Constants about the protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The version number for this protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants.PipeName
member.summary: The name of the named pipe. A process id is appended to the end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants.ReadLengthPrefixedString(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Read a string from the Reader where the string is encoded as a length prefix (signed 32-bit integer) followed by a sequence of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants.WriteLengthPrefixedString(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Write a string to the Writer where the string is encoded as a length prefix (signed 32-bit integer) follows by a sequence of characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildProtocolConstants.ReadAllAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This task does not complete until we are completely done reading.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler
member.summary: This class handles incoming requests from the client, and invokes the compiler to actually do the compilation. We also handle the caching of assembly bytes and assembly objects here.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler.HandleRequest(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: An incoming request as occurred. This is called on a new thread to handle the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler.CSharpCompile(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: A request to compile C# files. Unpack the arguments and current directory and invoke the compiler, then create a response with the result of compilation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler.CSharpCompile(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.IO.TextWriter,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Invoke the C# compiler with the given arguments and current directory, and send output and error to the given TextWriters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler.BasicCompile(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: A request to compile VB files. Unpack the arguments and current directory and invoke the compiler, then create a response with the result of compilation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerRequestHandler.BasicCompile(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.IO.TextWriter,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Invoke the VB compiler with the given arguments and current directory, and send output and error to the given TextWriters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger
member.summary: Class for logging information about what happens in the server and client parts of the Roslyn command line compiler and build tasks. Useful for debugging what is going on.
member.remarks: To use the logging, set the environment variable RoslynCommandLineLogFile to the name of a file to log to. This file is logged to by both client and server components.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.#cctor
member.summary: Static class initializer that initializes logging.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Set the logging prefix that describes our role. Typically a 3-letter abbreviation. If logging happens before this, it's logged with "---".

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.LogException(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Log an exception. Also logs information about inner exceptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.Log(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a line of text to the logging file, with string.Format arguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Log a line of text to the logging file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.CompilerServerLogger.GetLoggingPrefix
member.summary: Get the string that prefixes all log entries. Shows the process, thread, and time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.UpdateKeepAlive(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Called when the server updates the keep alive value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener.ConnectionProcessed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when one or more connections have completed processing. The number of connections processed is provided in .

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection
member.summary: Abstraction over the connection to the client process. This hides underlying connection to facilitate better testing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.LoggingIdentifier
member.summary: A value which can be used to identify this connection for logging purposes only. It has no guarantee of uniqnuess.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.ReadBuildRequest(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Read the object from the client connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.WriteBuildResponse(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildResponse,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Write the object to the client connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.CreateMonitorDisconnectTask(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Create a object which will complete if the client connection is broken by the client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IClientConnection.Close
member.summary: Close the underlying client connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.MetadataAndSymbolCache.GetUniqueFileKey(System.String)
member.summary:
A unique file key encapsulates a file path, and change date that can be used as the key to a dictionary. If a file hasn't changed name or timestamp, we assume it is unchanged.
Returns null if the file doesn't exist or otherwise can't be accessed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.CreateMonitorDisconnectTaskCore(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
The IsConnected property on named pipes does not detect when the client has disconnected if we don't attempt any new I/O after the client disconnects. We start an async I/O here which serves to check the pipe for disconnection.
This will return true if the pipe was disconnected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.ClientAndOurIdentitiesMatch
member.summary: Does the client of "pipeStream" have the same identity and elevation as we do?

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.NamedPipeClientConnection.GetIdentity(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the current user name and whether the current user is in the administator role.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher
member.summary: This class handles the named pipe creation, listening, thread creation, and so forth. When a request comes in, it is dispatched on a new thread to the interface. The request handler does the actual compilation. This class itself has no dependencies on the compiler.
member.remarks: One instance of this is created per process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CompletionReason.CompilationNotStarted
member.summary: There was an error creating the object and a compilation was never created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CompletionReason.Completed
member.summary: The compilation completed and results were provided to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CompletionReason.ClientDisconnect
member.summary: The compilation process was initiated and the client disconnected before the results could be provided to them.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.Connection
member.summary: Represents a single connection from a client process. Handles the named pipe from when the client connects to it, until the request is finished or abandoned. A new task is created to actually service the connection and do the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.Connection.CheckForNewKeepAlive(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.BuildRequest,System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCompletionSource{System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan}})
member.summary: Check the request arguments for a new keep alive time. If one is present, set the server timer to the new time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.s_defaultServerKeepAlive
member.summary: Default time the server will stay alive after the last request disconnects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.s_GCTimeout
member.summary: Time to delay after the last connection before initiating a garbage collection in the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.Main(System.String[])
member.summary: Main entry point for the process. Initialize the server dispatcher and wait for connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.#ctor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IRequestHandler,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IDiagnosticListener)
member.summary: Create a new server that listens on the given base pipe name. When a request comes in, it is dispatched on a separate thread via the IRequestHandler interface passed in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.ListenAndDispatchConnections(System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This function will accept and process new connections until an event causes the server to enter a passive shut down mode. For example if analyzers change or the keep alive timeout is hit. At which point this function will cease accepting new connections and wait for existing connections to complete before returning.
member.remarks: The server as run for customer builds should always enable watching analyzer files. This option only exist to disable the feature when running in our unit test framework. The code hooks in a way that prevents xUnit from running correctly and hence must be disabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.WaitForAnyCompletion(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.ConnectionData},System.Threading.Tasks.Task[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The server farms out work to Task values and this method needs to wait until at least one of them has completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CheckConnectionTask(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.ConnectionData},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan}@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Checks the completed connection objects.
member.returns: True if everything completed normally and false if there were any client disconnections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CreateListenTask(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Task that waits for a client connection to occur and returns the connected object. Throws on any connection error.
member.param: Name of the pipe on which the instance will listen for requests.
Used to cancel the connection sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.CreateHandleConnectionTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream},System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCompletionSource{System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Task representing the processing of the new connection. Returns null if the server is unable to create a new Task object for the connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.ConstructPipe(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of the pipe. This might be the first instance, or a subsequent instance. There always needs to be an instance of the pipe created to listen for a new client connection.
member.returns: The pipe instance or throws an exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.ServerDispatcher.MemoryHelper
member.summary: Uses p/invoke to gain access to information about how much memory this process is using and how much is still available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CompilerServer.IRequestHandler
member.summary: The interface used by to dispatch requests.
